com.microblink.fragment.overlay.verification

Class BaseVerificationOverlayController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microblink.fragment.overlay.verification.BaseVerificationOverlayController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScanningOverlay, GlareCallback, ScanResultListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocumentVerificationOverlayController

    public abstract class BaseVerificationOverlayController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ScanningOverlay, GlareCallback

    • Method Detail

      • onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached

        public void onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached(@NonNull
                                               RecognizerRunnerFragment recognizerRunnerFragment,
                                               @NonNull
                                               android.app.Activity activity)
        Description copied from interface: ScanningOverlay
        Called after RecognizerRunnerFragment gets attached to its host activity. This happens before RecognizerRunnerFragment.onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle) which internally invokes ScanningOverlay.onRecognizerRunnerViewCreated(RecognizerRunnerFragment). This means that at the time this method is invoked, methods like RecognizerRunnerFragment.getRecognizerRunnerView() or RecognizerRunnerFragment.getContentLayout() will return null. However, this is a good place to register your LifecycleObserver with RecognizerRunnerFragment.registerLifecycleObserver(LifecycleObserver) if your overlay needs to be notified about lifecycle events of RecognizerRunnerFragment.
        Specified by:
        onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached in interface ScanningOverlay
        Parameters:
        recognizerRunnerFragment - RecognizerRunnerFragment that has been attached to host activity.
        activity - Activity to which RecognizerRunnerFragment has been attached.

      • onRecognizerRunnerViewCreated

        public void onRecognizerRunnerViewCreated(@NonNull
                                          RecognizerRunnerFragment recognizerRunnerFragment)
        Description copied from interface: ScanningOverlay
        Called when RecognizerRunnerView has been created within given RecognizerRunnerFragment. You can use RecognizerRunnerFragment.getRecognizerRunnerView() to get the created RecognizerRunnerView and configure it. The most important thing you should do in this method is to set RecognizerBundle to created RecognizerRunnerView using RecognizerRunnerView.setRecognizerBundle(RecognizerBundle). You can also register various callbacks to RecognizerRunnerView, except CameraEventsListener (using BaseCameraView.setCameraEventsListener(CameraEventsListener)) and ScanResultListener (using RecognizerRunnerView.setScanResultListener(ScanResultListener) - those two listeners will be set to RecognizerRunnerView within RecognizerRunnerFragment after calling this method - if you need to observe camera events within RecognizerRunnerFragment, you can set your own BaseCameraEventsListener to it with RecognizerRunnerFragment.setCameraEventsListener(BaseCameraEventsListener). In this method, you can also access RecognizerRunnerFragment's content layout with method RecognizerRunnerFragment.getContentLayout() and add your views to it.
        Specified by:
        onRecognizerRunnerViewCreated in interface ScanningOverlay
        Parameters:
        recognizerRunnerFragment - RecognizerRunnerFragment within which RecognizerRunnerView has been created.

      • onCameraTorchSupportStatusAvailable

        protected abstract void onCameraTorchSupportStatusAvailable(boolean cameraTorchSupported)
        This method is called when camera preview is started and camera torch(flashlight) support status is available.
        Parameters:
        cameraTorchSupported - whether active camera supports torch(flashlight) or not.

      • createDocumentStepCameraOverlay

        @NonNull
protected abstract android.view.View createDocumentStepCameraOverlay()
        Creates and returns camera overlay view for the document verification step. This is appropriate place where references to all camera overlay subviews, that must be available later, should be obtained.
        Returns:
        created camera overlay view.

      • onStartDocumentFirstSide

        protected abstract void onStartDocumentFirstSide(boolean isCameraPreviewStarted)
        Callback method that is called when document recognizer is set to scan first side and recognition is started. This method is called after the document step camera overlay has been created. This is appropriate place to make appropriate UI changes, e.g. show messages about started step/side, show splash screen, etc.
        Parameters:
        isCameraPreviewStarted - whether camera preview has been already started or not. If the camera preview has not been started yet (value is false), method BaseCameraEventsListener.onCameraPreviewStarted() will be called when/if the camera is successfully started.

      • onStartDocumentSecondSide

        protected abstract void onStartDocumentSecondSide(boolean isCameraPreviewStarted)
        Callback method that is called when document recognizer is set to scan second side (only if second side exists) and recognition is started. This method is called after the document step camera overlay has been created. This is appropriate place to make appropriate UI changes, e.g. show messages about started step/side, show splash screen, etc.
        Parameters:
        isCameraPreviewStarted - whether camera preview has been already started or not. If the camera preview has not been started yet (value is false), method BaseCameraEventsListener.onCameraPreviewStarted() will be called when/if the camera is successfully started.

      • onGlare

        public abstract void onGlare(boolean glareDetected)
        Callback that is called during recognition process when/if the glare is detected on the scanned document. This is appropriate place to perform UI updates and inform user that glare is detected (or that glare is not present any more).
        Specified by:
        onGlare in interface GlareCallback
        Parameters:
        glareDetected - whether glare is detected or not.

      • createAdditionalStepConfiguration

        @Nullable
protected abstract BaseVerificationOverlayController.AdditionalStepConfiguration createAdditionalStepConfiguration()
        Creates configuration for the additional verification step that can be performed in the verification flow in addition to the document recognizer step.
        Returns:
        configuration for the additional verification step that can be performed in the verification flow in addition to the document recognizer step, or null if the additional verification step is not needed. In that case additional step will not be performed.

      • findString

        @AnyThread
 @NonNull
protected java.lang.String findString(int textId,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           java.lang.String text,
                                                           @StringRes
                                                           int defaultTextId,
                                                           @NonNull
                                                           android.content.Context context)
        Chooses which string will be used among given strings. If the given string resource id is not 0 uses string obtained from that resource id, otherwise uses given String object if it is not null. If strign resource is 0 and String is null then string resource defaultTextId is used.
        Parameters:
        textId - resource id of the string that will be used, or 0 if it is not set.
        text - string that will be used if textId is not set.
        defaultTextId - resource id of the string that will be used if textId is 0 and text is null
        context -
        Returns:
        chosen string
